medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe right-sided abdominal and flank pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain began 18 hours before presentation, worsened with movement and occurred independently of eating or body position. The patient also noted a change in urine color to dark tea, with no frank blood present.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hypothyroidism, autoimmune alopecia, and transient acantholytic dermatosis (Groverâ€™s disease). Recent hospitalization for widespread deep-vein thrombosis in the left leg diagnosed 1 week prior to presentation.
medical_history.social_history: Patient does not smoke or consume alcohol.
